result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Lee Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randy Lee Meyer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randy Lee Meyer was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 - 4.
Defendant to report to Probation by Thursday September 29, 2016 by 4:00 p.m.
If restitution is paid early the Court will consider reducing Probation time.
Court notes no credit for time served.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Joint and Several with Charlene Stuart and Bridget Eisele.
Apply $50.00 on file and balance of $6150.00 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF99.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF99.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF99.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Bridget E., Lisa B. or her residence.
-Defendant to write a letter of apology.
-Defendant to complete a Victim Empathy Seminar.
-Defendant to maintain work and/or education.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing and any recommended follow through.
-Defendant to complete MRT if recommend by the Agent.
-Defendant to maintain any mental health treatment.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time, STAYED.
Defendant to serve 10 days jail per year of Probation.
First 10 days to be served within the first 3 months of probation.
Defendant is eligible for Huber.
Defendant to complete 30 hours of community service per year of probation.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant remanded into custody.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: $7595.50 restitution to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #15CF99.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Bridget Eislie, Lisa Burns or their residence.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to continue with mental health treatment as a dual diagnosis treatment.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to maintain employment.
Continue with AODA and follow any recommendations.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Randy Lee Meyer appeared from jail. Case called at 9:25. Court reviews file and informs DE of the charges. ADA Kelly updates the court. ADA Kelly gives sentencing recommendations. Atty. Caton gives recommendations. DE makes a statement. Atty. Caton responds. 

6 years total confinement
2 years initial
4 years ES
Court notes 56 days credit. 
Conditions of ES:
- DE to  have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Bridget Eislie. Lisa Burns or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Continue with AODA and any recommended follow through.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE to and continue with mental health treatment as a dual diagnosis treatment. 
- DE not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- DE to maintain employment. 
- DE to pay restitution of $7,595.50.

DE eligible for the substance abuse program.
DE eligible for the challenge incarceration program. 

DE is remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Randy Lee Meyer appeared. Case called at 3:32. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CF99. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CF99. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3 and 4 in 15CF99. Sentencing arguments. Court orders a PSI. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Randy Lee Meyer appeared. Case called at 10:22. Court reviews file. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. State to provide discovery including any video. Address confirmed. Bond continues. DE to pay $50 today.  Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

**AMENDED**

DE to bring in $50 at the preliminary date of 10-27-2015.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ms. Burns. or Bridget E.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Lisa Burns and her residence and Bridget E.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
